types.description: Converts raw sensor temperature readings to Kelvin packets. Conversion to Kelvin is done using: 1/(log(((i-r)*Rc/r)/Rt)/B + 1/T - where i is input range, r is raw sensor value, Rc is potential divider resistor resitance, Rt is thermistor resistance, B is thermistor constant and T is thermistor reference temperature.
types.name: grove/temperature-converter

types.description: Gets sensor temperature in Kelvin. Conversion to Kelvin is done using: 1/(log(((i-r)*Rc/r)/Rt)/B + 1/T - where i is input range, r is raw sensor value, Rc is potential divider resistor resitance, Rt is thermistor resistance, B is thermistor constant and T is thermistor reference temperature.
types.name: grove/temperature-sensor

members.description: Valid bits mask. This mask is used to filter the valid bits from the data received from hardware (which is manufacturer dependent), therefore should not be used as a way to change the output range because the mask is applied to the least significant bits.
members.name: mask

members.description: Polling time in milliseconds. This option will take no effect if hardware interruptions for GPIO is supported by the underlying system. Use it if you know that you don't have those interruptions available.
members.name: poll_timeout

types.description: LCD grove controller (JHD131M1 model) for simple string displaying and backlight color setting. It uses two I2C addresses, one to control an HD44780 based display and one for RGB backlight. Display matrix is 16x2.

in_ports.description: Set string to be displayed. If it's bigger than 16 characters, it breaks it to the second line. If it's bigger than 32 (what fits on the two display lines), it'll be cropped to this length.
in_ports.name: IN

types.name: grove/lcd-string

types.description: LCD grove controller (JHD131M1 model) for custom character/cursor manipulation and backlight color setting. It uses two I2C addresses, one to control an HD44780 based display and one for RGB backlight. Display matrix is 16x2.

in_ports.description: Set whether auto-scrolling is on or off. After it's set to on, the cursor position is held static until one sets it off again (or changes it explicitly).
in_ports.name: AUTO_SCROLL

in_ports.description: Set character entry direction to be left-to-right (true) or right-to-left (false).
in_ports.name: LEFT_TO_RIGHT

in_ports.description: Set display's current column. Valid range is 0-16 (16 is a virtual position useful when writing on the last column in right-to-left mode).
in_ports.name: COL

in_ports.description: Set display's current row. Valid range is 0-1.
in_ports.name: ROW

in_ports.description: Set whether the display's blinking cursor is on (true) or off (false).
in_ports.name: BLINK_CURSOR

in_ports.description: Set whether the display's underline cursor is on (true) or off (false).
in_ports.name: UNDERLINE_CURSOR

in_ports.description: Set whether the display is on (true) or not (false). Naturally, it starts on by default.
in_ports.name: DISPLAY_ON

in_ports.description: Write given character at display's current row/column and advance them one position. The column will raise or lower depending on the entry direction, and no wrapping will occur -- if either top-left or bottom-right of the screen is hit, further char writes will update those limit cells until one changes the cursor position explicitly.
in_ports.name: PUT_CHAR

in_ports.description: Write a sequence of characters at display's current row/column and advance the cursor's position. The cursor's position will change differently depending on the entry direction, and, if either top-left or bottom-right of the screen is hit, the string will be cropped at that point.
in_ports.name: PUT_STRING

in_ports.description: Shift/scroll right the whole display by one column, keeping the char cell states (lcd's RAM state) as it was. Thus, a subsequent shift left will bring the display to what it looked like before the first shift.
in_ports.name: SCROLL_RIGHT

in_ports.description: Shift/scroll left the whole display by one column, keeping the char cell states (lcd's RAM state) as it was. Thus, a subsequent shift left will bring the display to what it looked like before the first shift.
in_ports.name: SCROLL_LEFT

in_ports.description: Clear the whole display, also resetting cursor to the top-left position.
in_ports.name: CLEAR

types.name: grove/lcd-char

members.description: Whether to start on left-to-right (true) or right-to-left (false) cursor advancing.
members.name: ltr

members.description: Set whether the display's blinking cursor is on (true) or off (false).
members.name: blink_cursor

members.description: Set whether the display's underline cursor is on (true) or off (false).
members.name: underline_cursor

members.description: Whether to start on auto scroll mode (true) or not (false).
members.name: auto_scroll
